abstract: United States assists Iraqi forces in retaking Ramadi from Islamic State; military experts expect fierce struggle to expel dug-in militants from Mosul, even as Islamic State shows signs of weakening; some consider pace of counter-offensive too slow and advocate for more ground troops.
lead_paragraph: The tactics of the Islamic State, which combine insurgent and conventional military strategy, are being put to the test in Ramadi, Iraq, where about 10,000 Iraqi troops are preparing a push.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Prepare Next U.S.-Backed Attack on ISIS, With Mosul on Horizon
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Forces Prepare Next U.S.-Backed Attack on ISIS, With Mosul on Horizon
